author: Staff Reporter
text:
Road Safety Week, observed across the country every year, was inaugurated at the Mattuthavani integrated bus stand in the city on Sunday morning.

Minister for Cooperation ‘Sellur’ K. Raju, Collector L. Subramanian, Mayor V.V. Rajan Chellappa and Deputy Commissioner (Traffic), Madurai City, A.G. Babu, and other senior officials inspected an awareness exhibition set up by the Transport Department at the bus stand.

The Minister, Mayor and the distributed pamphlets to the public seated in buses to create awareness of safety measures to be followed.

Mr. Raju later flagged off an awareness rally by Transport Department employees from the Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) bus depot near Mattuthavani.

J.K. Baskaran, Regional Transport Officer (Madurai Central), said that while the week was observed from January 10 to January 16 across the country, it was observed from January 10 to January 19 in the State owing to Pongal holidays. Various events such as free eye screening camps and rally to create awareness of importance of wearing helmets with the participation of 1,500 people, free diabetes and blood pressure camps had been planned, he said.
title: Road Safety Week begins in city
